t:
Tyler and Rose had spent years working in the same building, yet their paths had never crossed. Their offices occupied different floors of the towering structure, each one leading a life of routine and solitude until one fateful night changed everything.

                                                    cont...
c:
Tyler, a dedicated worker, found himself with an unusual workload that forced him to stay late at the office. As the evening wore on, he finished his tasks and decided to call it a night. He made his way to the elevator, a silent vessel in the quiet building. Alone, he pressed the button to descend, expecting nothing out of the ordinary.

On the next floor, Rose, a woman of grace and professionalism, stepped into the lift. Her office was typically one bustling with activity, but tonight she, too, had been caught up in the demands of her job. As the elevator continued its descent, a sudden jolt brought it to an abrupt halt. The building was plunged into darkness as a power outage swept through the area.

Panic set in as Tyler fumbled for his phone, desperately seeking a signal, but to no avail. Rose, equally flustered, found herself in the same predicament. In the eerie silence, Tyler cleared his throat nervously, trying to lighten the mood, “Well, this is an unexpected adventure.”

Rose, who had been silently cursing her luck, couldn't help but chuckle at the situation, “I suppose it is. At least we're not alone.”

In the dim light of their phones, they began to chat, initially about work and the oddity of the situation. Soon, they ventured into their personal lives, sharing anecdotes and stories. Tyler was enchanted by Rose's laughter, and Rose was captivated by Tyler's charm. Though both of them were married, they found themselves telling small lies, claiming to be single. It was as if the darkness and confinement of the elevator had given them the freedom to be someone else, to indulge in a brief escape from their everyday lives.

As the lights flickered back on, the lift resumed its descent, and a sense of relief washed over Tyler and Rose. They quickly exchanged phone numbers, determined to meet again and continue the connection they had formed.

When the elevator finally reached the basement, they reluctantly parted ways, heading to their respective cars. Their hearts felt a bit lighter, filled with the hope of a new and exciting chapter in their lives.

Tyler walked to his car, still feeling the electricity of the unexpected connection he had forged with Rose. But his surprise turned to shock as he saw a familiar face in the parking lot. It was Sarah, his wife, passionately kissing another man. He stood there, paralyzed, as his world crumbled around him.

Meanwhile, Rose sat in her car, feeling elated about the exciting new person she had met in the elevator. As she drove by, she saw Tyler standing in shock, staring at something in the distance. Her curiosity got the better of her, and she followed his gaze. Her heart sank as she witnessed Vincent, her husband, locked in an intimate embrace with another woman.

The two strangers, who had shared an unexpected connection in the darkness of the elevator, now shared an even deeper and more devastating connection outside of it. As Tyler and Rose stared at the shattered pieces of their marriages, they couldn't help but recognize the cruel irony of their situation. The power was back, the basement was lit, but the illumination of their lives had given way to a new, more profound darkness that seemed to stretch endlessly before them.
